explanation: The report is correct. MISRA C 2023 Rule 21.17 forbids uses of string.h functions that can access bytes beyond the bounds of the object pointed to. OS_strnlen is implemented as memchr(s, 0, maxlen) — memchr will attempt to read up to maxlen bytes from s. In OS_TranslatePath OS_strnlen(VirtualPath, OS_MAX_PATH_LEN) is called without any guarantee that the object referenced by VirtualPath actually occupies at least OS_MAX_PATH_LEN bytes. If the caller passes a shorter object (for example a string literal "abc" which is 4 bytes including the NUL), memchr may read past the end of that object, invoking undefined behavior and violating Rule 21.17. OS_CHECK_POINTER only tests for NULL and does not prevent this out-of-bounds access. Therefore Agent A’s violation report is correct.
